title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point cannot be earned implicitly by reporting t=2.831095; MathType@MTEF@5@5@@419E@ the setup must be shown.

A response that finds an incorrect value of t does not earn the second point.

A response may find and report extraneous solutions to the equation x ′  ( t )=0. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@408A@ If the response does not specifically eliminate the extraneous solutions, it will not earn the second point.

The second point can be earned by applying the Second Derivative Test. This includes reporting that x ′  ( t )=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FD8@ at t=2.831, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F73@ and that x ″ ( 2.831 )<0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41E4@ and therefore the particle changes direction when t=2.831. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F55@ Such a response need not report the value of x ″ (2.831), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FD7@ but if a value is presented it must be correct for the presented digits, up to three decimal places ( x ″ (2.831)=−6.938 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44CE@ ).

Degree mode: A response that presents answers obtained by using a calculator in degree mode does not earn the first point it would have otherwise earned. The response is eligible for all subsequent points (unless no answer is possible in degree mode or the question is made simpler by using degree mode). In degree mode, t=112.26587, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@426D@ which is not in 0<t<5.  MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F6C@ Therefore, such a response does not earn the second point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

A response that presents incorrect limits or no limits does not earn the first point, but, in the presence of the correct answer, does earn the second point.

A response that omits the absolute value on the integrand or uses x ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E4B@ for the integrand does not earn the first point, but, in the presence of the correct answer, does earn the second point.

A response that presents |   ∫ 1 4 x ′ (t) dt   | MathType@MTEF@5@5@@49B4@ does not earn the first point, but, in the presence of the correct answer, does earn the second point.

Degree mode: In degree mode, ∫ 1 4 | x ′ (t) | dt =0.813 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B3E@ (or 0.812 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIWaGaaiOlaiaaiIdacaaIXaGaaGOmaaaa@3CA1@ ). (See degree mode statement in part (a).)
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The minimum work needed to earn the first point is x ″ (4)=−1.732 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41B7@ (or −1.731 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D8F@ ).

a ( 4 )=−1.732 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4354@ (or −1.731 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D8F@ ) is not sufficient to earn the first point. The connection a(4)= x ″ (4), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40D0@ or a ( t )= x ″ (t), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4346@ must be explicitly made.

A response does not need to find the value of v ( 4 ); MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E8E@ the sign is sufficient. However, a response that reports an incorrect sign or value of v ( 4 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DCF@ does not earn the second point. A response must declare a value for x ″ (4) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C3D@ to be eligible for the second point.

If a value for v ( 4 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DCF@ is presented, that value must be accurate for the digits shown, up to three decimal places.

A response that declares an incorrect value of x ″ (4) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C3D@ is eligible for the second point. The conclusion must be consistent with the presented value of x ″ (4) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C3D@ and the correct sign/value of v ( 4 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E81@

Degree mode: In degree mode, x ″ (4)=a (4)=0.206 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4678@ (or 8.415 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaI4aGaaiOlaiaaisdacaaIXaGaaGynaaaa@3CA8@ ) and x ′ (4)=v (4)=0.531>0. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4902@ (See degree mode statement in part (a).)
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

A response that presents an integral of ∫ 0 5 | x ′  (t) | dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4818@ does not earn the first point.

· This response will earn the second point only for a value of x (5)=2+ ∫ 0 5 | x ′  (t) | dt =19.612. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@558C@

· If this response earns the second point, it will earn the third point only for reasoning that there is not sufficient information to determine whether there is a time t, for 0≤t≤5, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F88@ when the particle is at the origin. The reasoning must reference the Intermediate Value Theorem.

To earn the third point, the response must include:

· differentiability implies continuity (the continuity of x ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E4B@ by itself is insufficient),

· x ( 5 )<0<x ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@45F0@ or − 0.566  (or  − 0.565)<0<2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@50AA@ (this may be expressed in words or symbols), and

· “yes.”

A response of x (5)= ∫ 0 5 x ′ (t)dt =−2.566 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4D70@ (or −2.565 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB5@ ) earns the first point, does not earn the second point, and is eligible to earn the third point.

A response with incorrect or no limits of integration does not earn the first point. Such a response that presents the correct value of x ( 5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E11@ does earn the second point, and is eligible to earn the third point. A response with incorrect or no limits that presents an incorrect value of x ( 5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E11@ will not earn any points.

A response that solves the equation 2+ ∫ 0 t x ′ (s)ds =0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@45BA@ for t and reports a value of t=4.841  MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FEA@ earns the third point, but must correctly find x ( 5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E11@ in order to earn the first 2 points.

Degree mode: In degree mode, x( 5 )=2+ ∫ 0 5 x ′ (t)dt =3.479. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4D95@ (See degree mode statement in part (a).)
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
